titles.title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 2126) making appropriations for the Department of Defense for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1996, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 104-214, by Mr. Goss.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2126 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Points of order against provisions in the bill for failure to comply with clause 2 or 6 of rule XXI shall be waived. Measure will be read by title. Bill is open to amendments. Upon adoption of this resolution, an amendment striking sections 8021 and 8024 of the bill shall be considered as adopted in the House and in the Committee of the Whole. During consideration of the bill for amendment, the Chairman of the Committee may grant priority in recognition to those Members who have had proposed amendments printed in the Congressional Record.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 81.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 409 - 1 (Roll no. 601).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 7/28/1995--Introduced. Sets forth the open rule for the consideration of H.R. 2126 (Department of Defense appropriations).
